**Install and load the required packages**
```{r}
require(BSDA)
library(BSDA)
require(EnvStats)   
library(EnvStats)
```

***Generate data***
```{r}
n <- 14
set.seed(n)

a_data <- c()

get_a <- function(k) {
  a <- k * log(k^2 * n + pi)
  return (a - trunc(a))
}

a_data <- get_a(1:150)
x_data <- qnorm(a_data[1:100])
y_data <- qnorm(a_data[101:150])
```

#### Task 1
$H_0\,: \mu_1 = \mu_2 \quad \textrm{vs} \quad H_1\,: \mu_1 \ne \mu_2$

```{r}
z.test(x = x_data, y = y_data, mu = mean(x_data), alternative = "t", sigma.x = 1, sigma.y = 1);
```
In this task we can use the two-sided z-test for two samples. This is because we test means of two samples with known variances.
The general form of rejection region of the test $H_0\ vs\ H_1$ of level 0.05:

```{r}
t.test(x = x_data, y = y_data, alternative = "t", var.equal = TRUE);
```
